revised_title: An Account of the Earthquake in North England, December 28, 1703
tldr: In December 1703, an earthquake shook parts of northern England. The author, Mr. Thoresby, collected accounts from various locations, describing the experiences and reactions of people during the event. The earthquake was felt in places like Hull, Beverly, South Dalton, and Selby, causing fear and damage to buildings. The author also reflects on the possible connection between earthquakes, famines, and pestilences as signs of future calamities.
